abstracts.cdata!:
The first phase of the Education Sector
            Development Project will finance the renovation of a
            selected number of schools in pilot districts of Azerbaijan.
            The project for repairing and modernizing existing
            structures pose a number of challenges. Decay can rarely be
            determined prior to tearing out or dismantling an existing
            construction. Repairs of buildings should be executed during
            the summer academic recess to minimize disruption of
            schooling. Discovery of serious structural and mechanical
            problems during either the survey or construction phase
            poses serious ethical, legal and financial challenges. Leaky
            roofs if not promptly repaired will result in damage to
            structural components of buildings. The most common problem
            is decay of the timber trusses that support the roof. In
            order to arrest deterioration of buildings, essential
            repairs to elements such as roofs and foundations should be
            carried out. Maintain storm water drainage systems, replace
            broken window glasses, loose stair treads and floorboards to
            prevent deterioration of a building. Improve building
            insulation, caulking gaps between masonry walls and floor
            frames; install thermostatic controls on radiators and
            convectors and upgrading lighting systems will reduce cost
            of operation. Azerbaijan needs to consolidate small schools
            to form more economical units wherever practical.
            Consolidation of schools will require the construction of
            additional classroom capacity at the receiving school.
